comment: Given a point ` F ` that belongs to an indexed product of (possibly unbounded) open intervals, then ` F ` belongs to an open product of bounded open intervals that's a subset of the original indexed product. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 8-Apr-2021.)
